intro: Aphelandra edmundoana, commonly known as the golden flame tree, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is characterized by its striking, elongated, yellow-orange inflorescences that resemble flames, making it a popular ornamental plant. The plant belongs to the Acanthaceae family and typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Aphelandra edmundoana thrives in humid, sunny environments and is well-suited for tropical and subtropical climates.
